title: Private View
description: Enter the delightful world of Beryl Cook.With her salty sense of humour, lightness of touch and robust enjoyment of life, she parades before us sailors and seagulls, strawberry pickers and dustbinmen, and as she moves from Plymouth Hoe to Paris and London few escape her deliciously wicked brush.'The joy of Beryl's paintings is their seemingly simple, colourful, life-affirming vulgar cheerfulness.' - Woman's Journal'I suspect Beryl's paintings will be remembered and cherished long after most late 20th-century art is forgotten.' - Edward Lucie-Smith
author: Beryl Cook
